docs.title: DATAIDEA DOCS
docs.text:
• Data Science

    Programming for Data Science is our comprehensive curriculum designed to equip you with the skills needed to thrive in the world of data-driven decision making.

    Data Science Resources

  • Video Tutorials

    Access our curated collection of video tutorials that complement our learning materials.

    YouTube Resources

  • Web Development

    Learn programming techniques to build dynamic and responsive websites and applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python with Django.

    Web Development Resources

  • Logging & Documentation

    Best tools for logging project events and llm interactions in data science and web development.

    Logger Documentation

docs.title: About DATAIDEA
docs.text: DATAIDEA is dedicated to helping people learn programming for Data Science and Web Development through structured, comprehensive, and up-to-date curricula. Our mission is to simplify complex technical concepts and provide hands-on learning experiences that prepare you for real-world challenges.

docs.title: What We Offer
docs.text:
• Comprehensive Courses: From Python basics to advanced Deep Learning with PyTorch
  • Structured Learning Paths: Clear progression from fundamentals to advanced topics
  • Practical Exercises: Hands-on projects that reinforce theoretical concepts
  • Expert Guidance: Learning materials created by experienced practitioners

docs.title: Our Educational Approach
docs.text: We believe in learning by doing. Our documentation and courses are designed with practical applications in mind, helping you build a portfolio of projects as you learn. Whether you're a complete beginner or looking to expand your existing skills, our resources cater to learners at all levels.

docs.title: Stay Updated
docs.text:
To be among the first to hear about future updates to our learning materials:

  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Subscribe to our YouTube channel
  • Visit our main website: www.dataidea.org
Contact Us

Email: dataideaorg@gmail.com

Phone: +256701520768 / +256774128257

docs.title: Loading Datasets
docs.text:
Make sure you have the dataidea package installed. You can install as

Install DATAIDEA
pip install -U dataidea

docs.title: Load a dataset
docs.text:
Load Boston Housing Dataset
from dataidea.datasets import load_dataset

boston_data = load_dataset('boston')

docs.title: Logging Events
docs.text:
Make sure you have the dataidea package installed. You can install as

Install DATAIDEA
pip install -U dataidea

Note

You also need an api key and a project for your logs, you can create them from the dataidea logger website

Setup your api key in a dot env file with a name like DATAIDEA_API_KEY

Read the api key

Get API Key
import os 

api_key = os.getenv('DATAIDEA_API_KEY')

docs.title: Import event_log method.
docs.text:
We use this method for logging our data. It can be imported directly as:

Import event_log directly
from dataidea import event_log

It can also be imported via its utils module

import event_log via utils module
from dataidea.utils.logging import event_log

docs.title: Log an event
docs.text:
Log an event
event_log({
        'api_key': api_key,
        'project_name': 'Test Project',
        'user_id': '1234567890', # optional
        'message': 'This is a test message',
        'level': 'info',
        'metadata': {'test': 'test'} # optional
    })

docs.title: Logging LLM Interractions
docs.text:
Make sure you have the dataidea package installed. You can install as

Install DATAIDEA
pip install -U dataidea

Note

You also need an api key and a project for your logs, you can create them from the dataidea logger website

Setup your api key in a dot env file with a name like DATAIDEA_API_KEY

Read the api key

Get API Key
import os 

api_key = os.getenv('DATAIDEA_API_KEY')

docs.title: Log an interraction
docs.text:
Log LLM interraction
from dataidea.logger import llm_log

llm_log({
        'api_key': api_key,
        'project_name': 'Test Project',
        'user_id': '1234567890',
        'source': 'gpt-4o',
        'query': 'This is a test query',
        'response': 'This is a test response',
        'metadata': {'extra': 'extra info'}
    })

docs.title: Loading Models
docs.text:
Make sure you have the dataidea package installed. You can install as 

pip install -U dataidea

docs.title: Download YouTube Videos
docs.text:
Make sure you have the dataidea package installed. You can install as

Install DATAIDEA
pip install -U dataidea
Download a video
# %% load the function
from dataidea import download_youtube

# %% Download a YouTube video
download(
    url="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9bZkp7q19f0",
    output_folder=".",)

docs.title: Another way
docs.text:
Download a video
# %% load the download function
from dataidea.io.youtube import download

# %% Download a YouTube video
download(
    url="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9bZkp7q19f0",
    output_folder=".",)

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
1. url: URL to youtube video (required)
  2. output_folder: Folder to store downloaded video (optional)
